item.description: Check out this video Steve performing at Torches on the Hudson
Check out Steve's interview with the Times Herald Record...
Check out the first, official steveblackonline persona! Wear it to show your support. Thanks!

New Discography page has been added.

You can download music and view album art. Give it a whirl...

The new site is up with it's minimalist design. But no worries, there's more to come!

Take a look around and don't forget to subscribe to the mailing list and shows feed...

Yesterday marked quite an astounding event that went over . . . what's the word? . . . Oh yeah, PERFECT!

Last night's performance with Justin and the Mid-Life Crisis was a huge success! Bobby-Q's was packed with spectators and the band was kicking it!

The star of the show, our 9 year old, drumming prodigy, was spot on with some solid backing from myself, his father, Rob, and our good friend James from Mixopolis Recording Studio. It was an hour or so performance, jam packed with good, old fashioned FUN. The band was well received and Justin was simply stellar!

Boys, if you're reading, well done fellas. Well done, indeed!

Tune into 101.5 WPDH radio on March 12th to hear me live on the air!

I will be performing during the Friday morning Karlson and McKenzie show, with guest DJ, 'Billy the Biker'. The show starts at 8:30am, so set your alarm clocks and make sure that you catch the show!!

My debut album, Hello, Goodbye, is finished and available for purchase. The album is fully loaded with 12 original songs, all full band, consisting of catchy hooks, lush harmonies, kick-ass guitars, and power driven rhythms.

The album is sure to satisfy anyone who hears it . . . in other words - there's a little something for everyone. Make sure you check out some clips of the songs on Hello, Goodbye.

This is it!! I have completed the recording process for my debut album, Hello, Goodbye. The album is now in its post production phase. So, continue to check back at the website for any further details and updates!!

I'm very excited and would like to thank everyone for being so patient and understanding during these chaotic times. Just wait a little longer! I promise that it will be well worth it.

Last night's show, opening for Duncan Sheik at Marist, was a huge success!!

The venue was sold out, and the crowd responded extremely well to my music.

Duncan was pleasant as always and his music was entrancing. This has most definitely been a landmark moment for my career.

I'd like to thank Bob, Sarah, everyone at student activities, and most importantly, Duncan, for one of the greatest days of my life. Cheers.
